Looking Back at 40 Years For the 40th anniversary of UC Davis Magazine, we delved into our archives to learn more about our own history.
 
 



Featured Stories
 
 
 








A Vegan Tasting Adventure
UC Davis Magazine intern Kristen Yeung taste tests offerings from the Yolo County Vegan Chef Challenge.






 
 







Center Stage
Three-time alumnus Kyle Holmes wrote the book on a musical that explores the darkness of high school life.






 
 







Where Are They Now?
Catch up with notable alumni who were featured in UC Davis Magazine.






 
 
 








Karate Chemist
Annaliese Franz, chemistry professor and associate dean, has a black belt in karate.






 
 







Meet the Master Brewer
Glen Fox, a leading expert in brewing science, talks climate change.






 
 







Work Experience
ESPN+ programming at UC Davis puts students in all the important roles of streaming a game.






 
 
 


News
 
 
 








Recovered and Restored
‘Mike Henderson: Before the Fire, 1965-1985’ is now showing at the Manetti Shrem Museum — with extended dates through July.






 
 







Going Electric
Unitrans, the campus-city bus system, commits to evolving its fleet with battery electric vehicles.






 
 
 








Campus Food Truck Offers Free Meals
The AggieEats truck is believed to be the first of its kind in the nation for a university.






 
 







C.N. Gorman Museum Expected to Open in Fall
The collection of Native American art moves to a newly renovated site in the former Nelson Hall.
